oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Peace Movements and Internationalism
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Nehring, Holger
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: peace movements
pacifism
nationalism
internationalism
transnational history
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This article charts the history of (European) peace movements as agents of internationalism in the long twentieth century. It highlights the rather ambiguous relationship between national trends and internationalist aspirations within European peace movements and also highlights their broadly Eurocentric views of the meaning and practices of internationalism.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Moving the Social; Vol. 55 (2016): Moving the Social. The Internationalism of Social Movements; 93-112
